subject: AI
title: Metadata Enrichment
description: Attach metadata to chunks to improve filtering and retrieval.

hook.text: A user asks about 'return policy for electronics.' Your vector search finds similar text in 'return policy for groceries.' Semantic similarity doesn't know about product categories.

buildup.text: Metadata enrichment tags each chunk with structured attributes: source document, section title, category, date, product type. You can then filter by metadata before or after vector search.

discovery.text: Hybrid retrieval: first filter by metadata ('category = electronics'), then run vector search within that subset. This combines precision of structured queries with flexibility of semantic search.

twist.text: Over-filtering can exclude relevant results. If no chunk matches the filter, the system returns nothing. Always have a fallback: broaden filters or fall back to pure semantic search.

climax.text: Every chunk should carry at least: source URL, document title, section header, and creation date. These cost nothing to store and unlock powerful filtering.

punchline.text: Vectors find similar meaning. Metadata finds the right context. Use both.

quiz.question: How does metadata improve RAG retrieval?
options: It enables filtering by structured attributes before or alongside semantic search
It reduces the size of embeddings
It is only useful for sorting results by date
